 For instance: people who have has to deal with a personal tragedy involving gun violence are likly to have like opinions to the anti-gun crusaders due to having a strong emotional need for justice against something they blame for their personal pain. It's far easier to just blame the gun then deal with the real issues. Followers always take the path of least resistence. 
 
 Also you have the causeheads. The folks that get themselves all worked up about some cause or annother just to get attention. 
 
 Anti-gun sentiment is always emotionaly driven with no real facts or data or any kind of rational thought to back it up. Religion has little to do with it.
